		Question: what did st augustine do
		Answer:
answer: St Augustine was a Church Father who wrote notable works such as Confessions, De Magistro, On the Trinity, and Augustine's theory of coercion. He was a student of Paul of Tarsus and his mother was Saint Monica. His notable work, the Confessions, was published in 2010 under the title Restless Heart: The Confessions of Saint Augustine. He also wrote On Christian Doctrine.
